intro: Adelopetalum argyropum, commonly known as the silverleaf goosefoot, is a perennial plant native to North America. It is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, waxy hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in the summer months. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, with a slightly puckered texture. Adelopetalum argyropum is often found in moist soils along stream banks and in wetlands.
